comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Here is an article that mentions Alice Carpenter and the Progressive Party, and explains the wild political developments of 1912. www.theodoreroosevelt.org/life/bullmoose.htm

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Suffragist Alice Carpenter was the head of the Woman's Department of the National Progressive Party. In the photo above, she is addressing a streetcorner crowd in support of the Progressive Party's candidate for President, Theodore Roosevelt. Here is Ms. Carpenter's note to The New York Times (August 30, 1912), attacking the anti-Roosevelt writer, Gertrude Atherton: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2948784299/
